Message.Title: Wall St Cheat Sheet article asks "Are Amazon Lockers Going to Crush Walmart?"
Message.Msg: Seriously? Now we are supposed to believe that one of the primary attractive aspects of shopping with AMZN - having the package delivered right to your door in one or two days is no longer important to consumers? So people will now gladly travel out in the cold, the rain, the snow and fight traffic to get to some outlet to pick up their AMZN packages from a locker and bring them home? Can this business model get anymore ludicrous? Can the media look anymore stupid and clueless as demonstrated by asking such a stupid question?

Topic.Title: Wall St Cheat Sheet article asks "Are Amazon Lockers Going to Crush Walmart?"

Message.Msg: It just adds more cost to amazon. Does nothing to the profitability from my perspective.

Topic.Title: Wall St Cheat Sheet article asks "Are Amazon Lockers Going to Crush Walmart?"

Message.Msg: This article is another example of the mental disconnect in the business press when covering AMZN. The author states in the first paragraph that shopping at Amazon "can often be problematic" ... because items "might not fit, might be different than they appear online". She then goes on to say how lockers will improve the Amazon shopping experience. The stupidity of the business press when it comes to covering AMZN is appalling. 'Investing' in AMZN has never been anything other than gambling to see who cries chicken first and heads for the doors as this stock get pumped up by one irrational claim after another.

Topic.Title: WHO'S THE DUMBEST SHORT ON THE BOARD?

Message.Msg: No. I know that several people have experienced issues with posting today. Haven't had that experience otherwise for awhile. You are still smarting from the fact that everyone recognizes you as a mindless clown. People can choose to disagree with me, but I express thoughtful positions backed by factual arguments of actual results and emerging trends. I've taken this kind of abuse on every company I've bet against. Ski knows I'm almost always right in the bigger picture. CMG is gaining relative to all other restaurants since the shakeout, as I said it would. Its unit economics are vastly superior to everyone else's... INTC is going up, despite the ridiculous Apple rumor. It will continue to rise. I'm happy to be patient and add as the fast money accumulates more risk simply to scalp a little premium. Shares are being transferred from investors to traders every day. That's long term bearish...

Topic.Title: AND WHAT HAPPENED TO YOUR GUTLESS BUDDY CHALK?

Message.Msg: Nazzyboy:: Funny the way you disappear and reappear. I don't know anything about Chalk. I hope he's doing well. I know that, like me, he was long AAPL from the low 300s, so I suspect he is just fine... If you look at MY posts with respect to Apple, I said I'd consider shorting above 650 (never did, but no long position in Apple for any of this...). I've long argued Apple will have trouble sustaining its margins longer term as the smartphone cycle saturates and we move to replacement. It's why I like Google better... My Google/Amazon trade is doing just fine and will outperform for years to come. Same with INTC versus AMZN. I always manage the cash position to harness the predatory shakeouts to my advantage. I hate the way the capital markets have come to function, but I will benefit from it. As I've said all along, we'll see in 2013....

Topic.Title: Sincere Question

Message.Msg: I believe that the stock is being propped by heavy options traders who will exit on the 17th. Price hugged 232.5 in a very creepy manner. almost everybody including cramer is saying sell, price action after miss was short squeeze HFT, not new investors, a couple firms on a churn. you don't see 6M shares go down that quickly if it is real price discovery. Noticing that, I closed my short after getting to near even on it after tape read, and want more shares short, but hoping for another short squeeze for better fake #$%$ pricing. Consider that Bezos and Valentine sell in the 250+ range and they are not accelerating revenue at the pace that they should, the pe is over 3000 AND their holiday special pricing is so low, plus hurricane hurting people (not helping shopping) the power ismout and people need to rebuild their lives, not their exposure to streaming media on make nothing devices. I see revenue being even more disappointing, and a sub 200 price within 4 months. Are you willing to add short shares if it goes to 250, or are they going to break your patience? little can support their valuation, not for 10 years. But it just stays strong, which worries me that there is this major disconnect being the security and the company itself. may reinitiate short soon again and keep it a bit smaller so I can DCA of it ticks against me. 300 is NOT GOING TO HAPPEN. And you should get yesterday's loss back tomorrow. Their guidance was abysmal, and the stock improved 16% from post earnings low while AAPL is getting no p#$%$ whatsoever, and they actually are profitable. Kind of screwed up. Your trade will depend on your willingness or ability to stay the course and willingness/ability to go bigger. That feeling about it being drastically overvalued... Well it is right. when will the market get the picture and stop manipulating the price? Impossible to say if an earnings miss and poop guidance isn't doing it. I am betting options expiry.
